snippet: On a busy sports Saturday in the New York metropolitan area, a capacity crowd of 81,994 at MetLife Stadium watched the national soccer teams of Brazil and Argentina face off.
abstract: George Vecsey Sports of The Times column notes that on a busy sports Saturday in the New York metropolitan area, a capacity crowd of 81,994 at MetLife Stadium watched the national soccer teams of Brazil and Argentina face off, illustrating how far soccer has come in America.
lead_paragraph: On a busy sports Saturday in the New York metropolitan area, a capacity crowd of 81,994 at MetLife Stadium watched the national soccer teams of Brazil and Argentina face off.

headline.seo: Argentina vs. Brazil — Battle of Stars and a Sign of Soccer’s Arrival
headline.main: A Match Well Worth Stopping for on a Busy Day
